page.title: 08Our School
page.content: {Fr. Foster}built the school in the 1840s 'for the education of the lab- ouring classes'. There would have been about eighty children in the single room, which looks like a church nave with a stout central beam and queen post. On the roof hung the school bell till it was taken down in 1967. (Now it is calling the people of Mahe to church, in the{Indian Ocean}! ) At the turn of the century they made an extra room by joining up to the house next door, which was built for the Curate. It became Schoolhouse, for the Headteacher. In the sixties two new classrooms were built, and the new playground provided contains apple trees and a tall{Wellingtonia Sequoia. The PTA bought a swimming pool. But all of a sudden there were only twenty children - and{threats of closure.}But the school remains proudly open.
